review: This app is a one stop shop! It offers so many helpful techniques for people with all different mental disorders. I am a person who has a lot of anxious tendencies, and I found this app helped to calm both my thoughts and my breathing. For people that suffer from anxiety disorders, this app offers a deep breathing exercise like I learned in my PYS250 class. This technique prevents one from having an anxiety attack/eases one while having an anxiety attack. To perform the breathing exercise simply count to 4 while slowly breathing in, hold your breath for a moment, and then slowly breath out to 4. This exercise should last for 2 minutes. Slowing one‚Äôs breathing allows the parasympathetic nervous system to be activated, calming the body. Another technique the app uses is in vivo exposure for those with social anxiety. It has one imagine a social situation that makes them anxious but then walks them through the process of imagining a positive outcome to that situation. I am so glad I was able to find this app and take advantage of all it has to offer!

review: I give Sanvello a 4.5 out of 5 because it is really extensive in providing services and activities for mental health and self-care, but it can be a little tricky to navigate. There are so many different parts of the application that at first glance and the first time I experienced using the app, I felt overwhelmed with the amount of information, which is its biggest weakness. However, there are more strengths than weaknesses. For example, there are so many features and tools one can use, including guided meditation, health log, hope log, thoughts journal, goals log, and guided journeys where users can interact with other users. Upon signing into the app, users are required to answer questions so that the app can cater to the users‚Äô specific needs, mental health issues, and other issues one might be having. Sanvello is very secure, I feel safe and protected using it as they would not share my information because it is completely confidential. Another great aspect of this app is that they can connect/match users with life coaches and therapists, which may be intimidating and difficult to find elsewhere, if one doesn‚Äôt have any direction or guidance as to who they can seek help from. In addition, I like the images, icons, and colors used in the app is it is welcoming and calming at the same time. Although Sanvello has a wide age range starting from 12 through adulthood, I think encouraging adolescents to use this app can be beneficial for them. Overall, I believe Sanvello is an app‚Äôs usage for adolescents should be encouraged by social workers, teachers, parents, and other adult peers as it can help teach them how to learn, identify, and regulate their mental health while feeling supported by professionals and other peers that are feeling similarly to them.

Social networking site and applications benefit teenagers to learn and develop self-control, to respect to individuals‚Äô viewpoints, to engage in critical thinking techniques (Murphy et al., 2013). Beginning & To Start Off
Sanvello has been one of the best apps I‚Äôve reviewed so far. First off , the guided journeys are very helpful and beneficial , they‚Äôve also helped me with my mental health too. Also , if the guided journey hasn‚Äôt been helpful , you can rate it when it pops it. 

Features
The group chats and discussions and great. Plenty of people to chat , vent , give advice to and so much more. There hasn‚Äôt been a single mean or rude person on there because everyone on Sanvello is going through the same thing. The journal types are very detailed and clear , and the mood entires can be very helpful if you just wanna let your feelings out , but not in a direct way. 
Also , it tracks your progress and gives you a weekly check-in to let you know how you‚Äôve been doing. If you need anything , you can email them and they will respond very quickly! I‚Äôve had some issues with the app in the past they responded within a day or so.

Flaws & Things to Improve 
Sanvello is a great app , but it has its flaws and imperfections like anything. There‚Äôs probably features and bugs that need to be addressed , but I‚Äôll just say the ones off the top of my head. In group chats , it can cut off the links which can get annoying.

I‚Äôd strongly and high recommend Sanvello to anyone who‚Äôs going through a rough time , has mental health issues , or need a group of people to relate to in a really tough time. Thank you to all the readers to took the time to go through every word.
